trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control> class exposes a public <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.QueryAccessibilityHelp> event.
You can use the properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs> class to return custom help for a particular control to an accessible client, such as a screen reader.

When you handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.QueryAccessibilityHelp> event, you must set the values of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs.HelpNamespace%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs.HelpKeyword%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs.HelpString%2A> properties to appropriate values.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs.HelpKeyword%2A> property should be a string representation of a numeric Help topic ID.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.QueryAccessibilityHelpEventArgs"></xref> class.
The file containing Help for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref>.
The string defining what Help to get for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref>.
The keyword to associate with the Help request for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref>.
Gets or sets the Help keyword for the specified control.
The Help topic associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> that was queried.
Gets or sets a value specifying the name of the Help file.
The name of the Help file.
This name can be in the form C:\path\sample.chm or /folder/file.htm.
Gets or sets the string defining what Help to get for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref>.
The Help to retrieve for the accessible object.
